channel.title: Srl help
channel.description:
Well I dled srl, and then i put in in my scar folder but when i try and run any sript it always says this: Include file C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Desktop\Seans stuff\SCAR 2.03\includes\SRL\SRL.Scar does not exist. Include file C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Desktop\Seans stuff\SCAR 2.03\includes\SRL\SRL\Misc\PlayerForm.Scar does not exist. Include file C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Desktop\Seans stuff\SCAR 2.03\includes\SRL\SRL\Skill\Magic.Scar does not exist.
I have srl whats happening?
thx

item.title: Srl help
item.dc:creator: @paintball907 paintball907
item.description:
@paintball907 wrote:

Well, I moved it there and it still isn’t working, sorry to bother you and thx for trying. I think I might uninstall scar and try this all over lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Srl help
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

SRL.scar should be in SCAR 2.03/includes/SRL/

Read full topic

item.title: Srl help
item.dc:creator: @paintball907 paintball907
item.description:
@paintball907 wrote:

yeah its deleted, and its not at the top of my script…but it still says Include file C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Desktop\Seans stuff\SCAR 2.03\includes\srl\srl\core\AutoRespond.scar does not exist.
Failed when compiling

Oh and mabey its because I have srl.scar in the wrong place? I have it in SCAR 2.03\includes\srl\srl\core\

Read full topic

item.title: Srl help
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Hmmm, so you are still getting the error that Autorespond.scar doesn’t exist? I can’t thing of any other way that you are getting that error. Are you sure you went into SRL.scar and deleted {.include srl\srl\core\AutoRespond.scar}? Double Check.

The only other way you could be getting that error, is because it is at the top of the script you are running. Go to the very top of the script, and click on line one. Press CTRL+F, and search for “{.include srl\srl\core\AutoRespond.scar}” If the search finds anything, delete that line.

Read full topic

item.title: Srl help
item.dc:creator: @paintball907 paintball907
item.description:
@paintball907 wrote:

I deleted it and it still says the same thing, not Unknown Identifier Respond somewhere in AntiRandoms.scar…Thx for all the help dude

Read full topic

item.title: Srl help
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Thats Because AutoRespond is for devs only, and some special SRL Members who were sent it by Fakawi before SRL shut down.

Just go into SCAR 2.03\include\SRL\SRL.scar Then search for AutoRespond.scar You should find a line that says {.include SRL\SRL\core\AutoRespond.scar} Delete this line.

Go back to your script, and press start.

{
If you get this error: Unknown Identifier Respond somewhere in AntiRandoms.scar, then go into AntiRandoms.scar, search for FindNormalRandoms (Pres CTRL+F to search.) Press Search twice do you will find the Procedure. Once you find it, you will se a part that says for i:=1 to 17 do Change the 17 to 16 so it says for i:=1 to 16. Now search for Respond; and delete that line. Change the rest of the numbers after that AntiRandom, so they add up to 16.
}

Only do the part in the {}'s if you get another error.

Hope I fixed your problem!

Read full topic

item.title: Srl help
item.dc:creator: @paintball907 paintball907
item.description:
@paintball907 wrote:

Cheesehunk:

Are you sure that is the latest version of SRL? Because You shouldn’t get that error if at the top of the script you are using it says {.include SRLSRL.scar}

jees I cleared that up but now i get this…god lol Include file C:Documents and SettingsOwnerDesktopSeans stuffSCAR 2.03includessrlsrlcoreAutoRespond.scar does not exist.

I dled the includes file form thi site ( the sticky) and looked in there and it dosn’t even have htis one[br][size=1]Posted at: July 18, 2006, 10:13:59 PM[/size][hr]Any chance you could give me the script for that autoRespond and then I could just save it whre it need to go, or wouldn’t that work?

Read full topic

item.title: Srl help

item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Are you sure you didn’t extract them directly to [b]C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Desktop\Seans stuff\SCAR 2.03\includes[/b] ?

When you download it, you have to ‘Extract all’ and Extract them excactly to there.
